block.p: Alexa Stanton Hampton, a daughter of Duane Hampton of New York and the late
Mark Hampton, was married yesterday to Pavlos Papageorgiou, the son of Sonia Papageorgiou and Dr. Michel-Akis Papageorgiou of Athens.
Archbishop Nektarios of Leros, Kalimnos and Astipalea performed the Greek Orthodox ceremony at the Church of the Transfiguration of the Lord Our Savior in Athens.
Alexa Stanton Hampton, a daughter of Duane Hampton of New York and the late
Mark Hampton, was married yesterday to Pavlos Papageorgiou, the son of Sonia Papageorgiou and Dr. Michel-Akis Papageorgiou of Athens.
Archbishop Nektarios of Leros, Kalimnos and Astipalea performed the Greek Orthodox ceremony at the Church of the Transfiguration of the Lord Our Savior in Athens.

The bride, 29, became the chief executive of Mark Hampton Inc., her father's interior design company in New York, after his death in 1998. She graduated from Brown University. Her mother is a magazine writer.

The bridegroom, 30, is an investment banking associate in the telecommunications group at Merrill Lynch & Company in New York. He graduated from Georgetown University and received a master's degree in finance from the City University of London. His father, who is retired, was a career diplomat for Greece, having been its ambassador to South Africa, the Vatican and Portugal.
The bride and the bridegroom will take each other's names and will be known as Mr. and Mrs. Hampton-Papageorgiou. ''Modern families need modern adaptations,'' the bridegroom said.
